events.name: GDG Haifa Opening event!
events.description:
Meetup Agenda:

17:30 - 18:00: Gathering for pizza followed by an introduction.
18:00 - 18:40: HTML5 new APIs - Ido Green, Developer Advocate at Google.
18:40 - 19:00: Google for Entrepreneurs in Israel - Amir Shevat, Developer Relations Manager at Google.
19:00 - 19:40: Web App Essentials - Sergey Bolshchikov, Technion Graduate student, Front-End developer at New ProImage

See you soon!

Ido Green's blog: http://greenido.wordpress.com/
GDG-IL: http://gdg-il.appspot.com/

Wait a second... what's a GDG anyway?

The answer awaits here: http://developers.google.com/groups/

 

***
The group was founded by Technion students but any passionate developer is welcome to join our up and coming community and help make it a place to talk about technology, learn cool new things and meet great people!

events.name: Save the date - Multi-screen X

venue.name: Google Tel Aviv Campus
venue.address_1: Electra Tower, 98 Yigal Alon St., 26th floor.

events.description:
Day 1 - March 4th
9:30 Michal Levin - Creating great User Experience across Phones, Tablets and other devices
10:45 Android team - Building Android apps for multi screen
12:00 Ron Reiter - HTML5 for Multi screen (Responsive design)
13:20 Lunch
14:30 Ido Green - Mobile web apps
15:30 GDG BeerSheva - working with fragments.
16:30 until midnight - Split to code labs / hackathon at Campus Tel Aviv HackSpace

Day 2 - March 5th
9:30 Split to hackathon at Campus Tel Aviv HackSpace
14:00 Android team - Android design and quality guidelines
15:00 Android GDE - performance tips and tricks - Ran - "Making apps butter"
16:00 Yaakov Greenshpan - Phone and Tablets UX tips and tricks
17:30 Demos and Party

events.name: Web Development - From Theory To Practice
events.description:
The Talk
Reading about programming language technical aspects is an important step. This Meetup will focus on the next step - which is implementing the knowledge, good practices and integrating the different technologies we’ll learn in order to create a website.
This session assumes basic knowledge and guides you through more advanced material.

The Speaker
Sergey Bolshchikov, Technion Graduate student, Front-End developer at New ProImage.

Prerequisites
Basic understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery. Bring a laptop!

The Tools
Text editor: Notepad++, Sublime, vim
Browser: Google Chrome

Lecture Outline
 1. Understand The Purpose - Describe goals, functionality, and the structure of the project
2. Organize Your Life - Set up the project (files) structure that fits you best
3. Choose Your Comrades -  Researching and choosing the appropriate tools and libraries
4. Lay Out The Foundations - Create static layout
5. Add Some Make Up - Decorate it with CSS + id/class strategies
6. Divide & Conquer - Build each component
7. Bring Some Action - Implement the actions

Schedule
 18:00 - 18:30 Gathering
18:30 - 20:00 Talk
20:00 - 20:10 Break + Snacks
20:10 - 21:00 Writing Some Code

events.name: Web Development - Waking up your senses
events.description:
Next meetup is all about waking up your senses so make some noise, wear something colorful and get ready for two refreshing topics: Colors and Audio! Some of the questions that will be answered are what is color theory all about? How does our mind capture color? How can you synthesize audio on the web? And how can you analyze sound?

Speakers

Oren Rubin -  VP R&D at applitools, previously worked with Wix and IBM. Technion CS grad.

Roy Pearl - VP R&D at Treeopedia. Experienced multimedia web application developer.

Schedule

18:00-18:30: Gathering

18:30-19:30: Audio synthesis and analysis - Roy Pearl: 
Flash, JS, Google Web-Audio API, Mozilla Audio data API, playing with Chrome Canary with some amazing applications on top.

19:30-19:50: Break + Snacks, yum! :)

19:50-20:30: Color theory - Oren Rubin:
CSS, RGB, CMYK, HSI,  Focus Vs. Blur and some basic compactions using fourier transform.

events.name: Android Game team is coming to Israel
events.description:
Daniel Galpin, Daniel 'Wolff' Dobson from the Android Games team and Ikai Lan from the YouTube team are coming to Israel for a set of partners meetings, a code lab and a GDG event on the evening of the 26th of August. 

The sessions for GDG at Campus Tel Aviv will cover:

• Android 4.3 platform update

• Google Play game services on iOS/Android

• YouTube API's on iOS/Android

• Google Play In-App Billing and Developer Portal

Gathering is at 17:00PM, and the sessions will start at 17:30PM.

- Please note that this event does not replace the August GDG Tel Aviv meetup! 

- This event is a special event in which all GDG groups are part of (please don't attend the same event twice if you're in more than one GDG group).

- Rides: willing to give / need a ride ? share it here

events.name: DevFest IL
events.description:
Hi Guys,

GDG Haifa team would like to invite you to the biggest developers event in Israel - GDG IL DevFest!

The event will hold 3 different tracks:"Innovation","Android" and "Web & Cloud". It will take place on the[masked] at 14:00 ,Google Campus Tel Aviv

We've teamed up with the biggest developers communities and brought the best lectures you can find, all in order to provide you guys with the best there is!

Reserve your tickets now and find the full agenda at:DevFest.gdg.co.il

Cheers,Mor & Alex

events.name: Vint Cerf - "the father of the internet" @ Campus TLV

venue.name: Google Tel Aviv Campus
venue.address_1: Electra Tower, 98 Yigal Alon St., 26th floor.

events.description:
On November 7th Campus TLV is delighted to host Vint Cerf, Vice President and Chief Internet Evangelist for Google, that will share his insights with the Israeli technological community.

Widely known as a "Father of the Internet," Vint is the co-designer with Robert Kahn of TCP/IP protocols and basic architecture of the Internet. Today, Dr. Cerf works as the Vice-President for Google where he also serves as Chief Internet Evangelist. Last June, he received the “Queen Elizabeth Prize for Engineering” from the Queen herself which honored only five pioneers of the Internet. Vint is also the president of the ACM. Dr. Cerf is also the recipient of the 2004 ACM Turing Award.

Agenda:

19:00 - Welcoming and light refreshment

19:30 - Talk by Vint Cerf and Q&A with Yossi Matias

20:15 - Mingling

events.name: Ruby Sparkles
events.description:
It's time to see what the hype is all about, please turn on this song before reading for the full effect :)

Ruby is a dynamic, reflective, object-oriented language that's expressive and easy to pickup. This session will introduce you to Ruby and the Ruby ecosystem. 

With Ruby you can do more with less coding in part of the time comparable to other languages, get more work, develop web apps quickly and even customize the language.

Speaker

Muhammad Zahalqa is a hands on architect experienced in enterprise large scale systems. He speaks more than 8 programming languages, currently focused on C++11, Scala, Ruby and Java. Also acts as a co-organizer of GDG Nazareth.

Schedule

18:45-19:00   Gathering
19:00-19:45   Ruby - the essentials 
19:45-20:15   Pizzas and drinks 
20:15-21:00   Ruby ecosystem

* Bonus: hear all about the upcoming hackathon at the Technion

events.name: A world through Glass
events.description:
A first meetup around Google Glass, join in for a peek at the future of wearable tech and its impact on developers.

<b style="font-size : 14px">Speaker

Jonathan Schipper, Founder, Builder, Breaker, Maker at Johnny505 Studios

Schedule

18:45-19:00 - Gathering

19:00-19:40 - A world through Glass

19:40-20:00 - Pizza! 

20:00-20:30 - UX on Glass

events.name: Start Your Engines!
events.description:
AppEngine is an amazing product, in the lecture we'll give an overview about the platform and dive deeper into the various possible applications, including touchpoints and examples with simple web and mobile aplications

https://developers.google.com/appengine

Speaker - Shay Erlichman

From a very early age Shay enjoyed squeezing every cycle that his CPU could handle. A lot of servers burnt under his never ending quest to make things run faster. In the past few years he lets big corporations to take care of his servers while he makes sure that his clients and companies don't need to break the bank in the process. He is an avid AppEngine developer and one of the first users of Cloud computing.

Schedule

18:30-19:00 Gathering

19:00-19:40 Intro to AppEngine

19:40-20:00 Pizza! ^_^

20:00-20:45 Diving deeper

events.name: An Intro to Angular.JS
events.description:
By popular demand, we're excited to announce the first Angular.JS meetup at the Technion!

HTML is great for declaring static documents, but it falters when we try to use it for declaring dynamic views in web-applications. AngularJS lets you extend HTML vocabulary for your application. The resulting environment is extraordinarily expressive, readable, and quick to develop.

Prerequisites

Basic knowledge in HTML, CSS and JavaScript

Schedule

18:30-19:00 - Gathering

19:00-19:40 - Angular.JS Overview - Shai Reznik

19:40-20:10 - Pizza!

20:10-21:00 - Live Coding Demo - Asaf David

Speakers

Shai Reznik - A frontend craftsman, Lean Entrepreneur, community activist (Runs 2 groups - Javascript Israel & Talking Lean), and an Angular.js consultant working with a few enterprise companies. www.shairez.com

Asaf David - An entrepreneur and a fullstack developer. Mamram graduate, over 10 years of experience, founder and CTO of TixWise and Bink. Web consultant.

events.name: Game Development 101
events.description:
We're back! This meetup we'll do something a bit different that's been on our mind for quite a while, Python game development. Let's roll:

Schedule

18:30-19:00 - Gathering

19:00-19:40 - Game development basics with Python - How to start writing computer games? Concepts, tools and libraries to help with your first steps in 2D and 3D computer game development.

19:40-20:00 - OMG Pizza! ^_^

20:00-20:30 - Turning your idea to a game - Hands on examples of games developed in hackathons, from the embarrassing to the innovative.

Speaker

Michael Sverdlin AKA Sveder - Gamer, mentor in Google's startup launchpad, co-organizer at GDG Tel Aviv, and a Python developer at Fairfly - changing the way airline tickets are bought.

** First timers are most welcome, it's recommended to go through this Python tutorial to get the hang of it: https://docs.python.org/2/tutorial/

** As in every meetup, we'll be giving away one free license for a JetBrains product of your choice. After this meetup, we have a feeling you'll go PyCharm! :)

events.name: The State of Wearables @ 2015
events.description:
This time we'll talk about the future of wearables and interfaces, hear about AND TRY RideOn - The new Israeli AR Ski Goggles. Personally, we're totally psyched! You should definitely check out the video on the IndieGoGo campaign, >100% funded. 

Live demos. Oculus Rift games. And, as always, an awesome GDG vibe.

Agenda

14:00-14:30 - Gathering

14:30-15:15 - Jonathan Schipper - Gemsense: The state of wearables 2015

15:15-16:00 - Ori Kotek - RideOn: The First True AR Goggles for Snow Sports! 

16:00-16:30 - OMG Pizzas!!! + Hands-on fun. Just don't try eating a pizza while wearing an Oculus Rift. You'll get dizzy!

Speakers

Ori Kotek - Co-Founder @ RideOn - A startup developing an augmented reality product. Their first applications are AR skiing and snowboarding goggles, featuring a see-through display, camera location and orientation sensors and a content database. The goggles are used for navigation, interaction with other users and for games and challenges.

Jonathan Schipper - Wearable Expert, fascinated with exploring the limits between body, tech and our surroundings. Co-Founder & VP Products @ Gemsense - a startup that provides a wearable tech platform for natural human interactions with digital things. Lecturer @ Bezalel Academy of Art & Design - Masters Program - Design & Tech. An enthusiastic Google, open source and security advocate (not necessarily in that order)

But wait there's more!

The event will be taking place during an awesome hackathon by WomenTechPro, the Technion's women CS meetup group. Read more about it right here: http://tinyurl.com/HackPROTechnion

events.name: Trading Places With An Investor: Would You Fund Your Own Startup?
events.description:
Understanding how investors evaluate startups and what triggers an investment is key to an entrepreneur's success. In this interactive session, Gil Ben-Artzy, UpWest Labs Partner, will offer concrete advice on topics such as: investor mindset, startup evaluation, fundraising strategies, etc.

Gil will be drawing from his experience working with 50+ startups that have successfully fundraised from VCs and Angel Investors in both Israel and the US.

Please note: The session will be conducted in English and is aimed at entrepreneurs looking to raise their Seed and Series A financing rounds.

events.name: Beyond the Code @ Google Haifa
events.description:
Hey everyone, first off, awesome news: Google are opening their doors for a first meetup at their Haifa office! This time around we'll be taking a hands-on approach to some of the developer skills that add on top of writing code. Hope to see you there! Check it out: 

Agenda

18:30 - 19:00 - Gathering, snacks and surprises ^_^

19:00 - 19:30 - Blogging for Developers

19:30 - 20:00 - Product & UX Design in Developer Tools

20:00 - 20:30 - Lockpicking for Hackers (Yes, real life locks!)  

Speakers

Alex Zhitnitsky - Your humble GDG organizer. An engineer on Takipi's product and marketing team, blogging developer content and news for over 100,000 monthly readers.

Guy Isacar - Lead UX/UI designer at Takipi, building the future of developer tools. Previously, he was an art director at an advertising agency. Lives by the Jedi code.

Michael Sverdlin AKA Sveder - Software developer, GDE (Google Developer Expert) and a mentor on the launchpad program. A 10-year veteran of the Israeli startup scene.

But wait there's more!

We'll give away some cool prizes during the meetup, please fill in this form to enter the raffle:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1AW_vB4g6OYS1VeTd7JPqtbIJqDI6t7LNh7bH2budND8/viewform

** All talks will be given in Hebrew

events.name: Inside Google @ Google Haifa
events.description:
Hi everyone, Google will be hosting our second meetup at their Haifa office! This time we will be hearing from two Google engineers about the technology behind their products. As usual, there will be refreshments and some cool prizes. Hope to see you there! Check it out: 

Agenda

18:00 - 18:30 -  Gathering snacks

18:30 - 19:15 - The Cutting Edge: Identity Standards at work in Google's mobile focused future by Ilan Caron 

Ilan will discuss why Google's login page no longer has a password field, along with other Identity tricks that Google uses.  Ilan will then discuss how other app developers use standards from OIDF, OIX, IETF, OAuth, & FIDO to implement the same tricks in their apps, as well as what tools Google provides to help developers achieve that goal.

19:15 - 20:00 - How do I autocomplete? by Ishai Rabinovitz 

Ishai will discuss the challenges of implementing a high-QPS, extremely low-latency distributed system, and demonstrate different features of Google Auto-complete.

Speakers

Ilan Caron - An Engineering Manager at Google who worked initially on the advertising side of Google's business and now works on identity and risk systems for Google accounts. Previously worked at Microsoft and AT&T Bell Labs. Graduated with BS in Computer Science from TAU and MS in Computer Science from Stanford University. 

Ishai Rabinovitz -  A software engineer on Google's Suggest team working on personalizing results for users. Previously, worked at Mellanox and IBM Research Labs. Graduated with BS and MS in Computer Science from Technion and MBA from TAU. 

But wait there's more!

We'll give away some cool prizes during the meetup, please fill in this form to enter the raffle:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1X88wtDXxkaKUsApwkagmzU0t-Y3m_7rjSwkrIE3dmXM/viewform

events.name: GDG Haifa Monthly Meetup @ Google Haifa
events.description:
Hi everyone, Google will be hosting our third meetup at their Haifa office! As usual, there will be refreshments and some cool prizes. Hope to see you there! Check it out: 

Agenda 

18:00 - 18:30 -  Gathering snacks 

18:30 - 19:15 - Are you experienced? User experience rules, pro-tips and patterns from a technical perspective, Royi Benyossef - Samsung

Royi will iterate over Google's quality application checklist, design guidelines and resource library, and material design guidelines. Royi will provide examples, clarifications and techniques to facilitate adherence along with tool suggestions from a developer's point of view.

Speakers

Royi Benyossef- has been an Android developer since before the first Android phone existed, and proceeded to work on development for Android based tablets and TVs long before they were launched by Google.
He is an avid Open Source enthusiast, Google Developer Expert, Mentor at Google's Lunchpad, and currently developer relation manager for a subsidiary of Samsung.

But wait there's more!

We'll give away some cool prizes during the meetup, please fill in this form to enter the raffle:

https://docs.google.com/a/google.com/forms/d/1RgTyevC5kH7VUOVkPsueeDkZHsvLYFmwgP1rTiDDIPs/viewform

answers.question: What would you like to learn about?
